intro: Veronica schinzii, commonly known as the alpine speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, blue or violet flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, adapted to withstand cold and windy conditions. Veronica schinzii thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine meadows and scree slopes.
